snippet: Residents of 475 Kent Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, are more secure about their homes thanks to a law that gives loft buildings a path to residential status.
abstract: Appraisal column; life has changed for loft dwellers of 475 Kent Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, in the six years since the building rocketed to citywide infamy after fire officials concluded that the illegal matzo factory in its basement could explode and evacuated structure; city's 2010 loft law grants a path to residential status and rent stabilization to eligible buildings that apply before the middle of March 2014.
lead_paragraph: Residents of 475 Kent Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, are more secure about their homes thanks to a law that gives loft buildings a path to residential status.

headline.main: Loft Life in a Building Once Evacuated Over Matzos
headline.print_headline: Loft Life in a Building Once Evacuated Over Matzos Is More Secure, and Legal
